description.en: Spend 3 Hope to transform into a Beastform without marking a Stress. When you do, choose one trait to raise by +1 until you drop out of that Beastform.
description.ru: Spend 3 Hope to transform into a Beastform without marking a Stress. When you do, choose one trait to raise by +1 until you drop out of that Beastform.

description.en: Mark a Stress to magically transform into a creature of your tier or lower from the Beastform list. You can drop out of this form at any time.
description.ru: Mark a Stress to magically transform into a creature of your tier or lower from the Beastform list. You can drop out of this form at any time.

description.en: You can perform harmless, subtle effects that involve nature — such as causing a flower to rapidly grow, summoning a slight gust of wind, or starting a campfire — at will.
description.ru: You can perform harmless, subtle effects that involve nature — such as causing a flower to rapidly grow, summoning a slight gust of wind, or starting a campfire — at will.

description.en: Mark a Stress to Channel one of the following elements until you take Severe damage or until your next rest: 1) fire - When an adversary within Melee range deals damage to you, they take 1d10 magic damage, 2) earth - Gain a bonus to your damage thresholds equal to your Proficiency, 3) water - When you deal damage to an adversary within Melee range, all other adversaries within Very Close range must mark a Stress, 4) air - You can hover, gaining advantage on Agility Rolls.
description.ru: Mark a Stress to Channel one of the following elements until you take Severe damage or until your next rest: 1) fire - When an adversary within Melee range deals damage to you, they take 1d10 magic damage, 2) earth - Gain a bonus to your damage thresholds equal to your Proficiency, 3) water - When you deal damage to an adversary within Melee range, all other adversaries within Very Close range must mark a Stress, 4) air - You can hover, gaining advantage on Agility Rolls.

description.en: You can assume an aura matching your element. The aura affects targets within Close range until your Channeling ends. 1) fire - When an adversary marks 1 or more Hit Points, they must also mark a Stress, 2) earth - Your allies gain a +1 bonus to Strength, 3) water - When an adversary deals damage to you, you can mark a Stress to move them anywhere within Very Close range of where they are, 4) air - When you or an ally takes damage from an attack beyond Melee range, reduce the damage by 1d8.
description.ru: You can assume an aura matching your element. The aura affects targets within Close range until your Channeling ends. 1) fire - When an adversary marks 1 or more Hit Points, they must also mark a Stress, 2) earth - Your allies gain a +1 bonus to Strength, 3) water - When an adversary deals damage to you, you can mark a Stress to move them anywhere within Very Close range of where they are, 4) air - When you or an ally takes damage from an attack beyond Melee range, reduce the damage by 1d8.

description.en: Mark a Stress to Channel one of the following elements until you take Severe damage or until your next rest: 1) fire - When an adversary within Melee range deals damage to you, they take 1d10 magic damage; you gain a +1 bonus to your Proficiency for attacks and spells that deal damage, 2) earth - Gain a bonus to your damage thresholds equal to your Proficiency; when you would mark Hit Points, roll a d6 per Hit Point marked. For each result of 6, reduce the number of Hit Points you mark by 1, 3) water - When you deal damage to an adversary within Melee range, all other adversaries within Very Close range must mark a Stress; when an attack against you succeeds, you can mark a Stress to make the attacker temporarily Vulnerable, 4) air - You can hover, gaining advantage on Agility Rolls; you gain a +1 bonus to your Evasion and can fly.
description.ru: Mark a Stress to Channel one of the following elements until you take Severe damage or until your next rest: 1) fire - When an adversary within Melee range deals damage to you, they take 1d10 magic damage; you gain a +1 bonus to your Proficiency for attacks and spells that deal damage, 2) earth - Gain a bonus to your damage thresholds equal to your Proficiency; when you would mark Hit Points, roll a d6 per Hit Point marked. For each result of 6, reduce the number of Hit Points you mark by 1, 3) water - When you deal damage to an adversary within Melee range, all other adversaries within Very Close range must mark a Stress; when an attack against you succeeds, you can mark a Stress to make the attacker temporarily Vulnerable, 4) air - You can hover, gaining advantage on Agility Rolls; you gain a +1 bonus to your Evasion and can fly.

description.en: You can create a space of natural serenity within Close range. When you spend a few minutes resting within the space, clear Stress equal to your Instinct, distributed as you choose between you and your allies.
description.ru: You can create a space of natural serenity within Close range. When you spend a few minutes resting within the space, clear Stress equal to your Instinct, distributed as you choose between you and your allies.

description.en: Touch a creature and spend 3 Hope. That creature clears 1d4 Hit Points.
description.ru: Touch a creature and spend 3 Hope. That creature clears 1d4 Hit Points.

description.en: You can target creatures within Very Close range and spend 3 Hope. That creature clears 1d4 Hit Points.
description.ru: You can target creatures within Very Close range and spend 3 Hope. That creature clears 1d4 Hit Points.

description.en: Spend 2 Hope to clear 2 Hit Points on 1d4 allies within Close range.
description.ru: Spend 2 Hope to clear 2 Hit Points on 1d4 allies within Close range.

description.en: When you're in Beastform and an ally within Close range marks 2 or more Hit Points, you can mark a Stress to reduce the number of Hit Points they mark by 1.
description.ru: When you're in Beastform and an ally within Close range marks 2 or more Hit Points, you can mark a Stress to reduce the number of Hit Points they mark by 1.
